bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 107 (Friday, July 10, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PETERSON:H.R. 3030.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, section 3, Clause 2: The Congress shall havePower to dispose of and make all needful Rules andRegulations respecting the Territory or other Propertybelonging to the United States[Page H5089]

item.title: H.R. 3030, Baudette Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure on March 2, 2016

summary.text:
Baudette Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

This bill directs the Coast Guard to convey specified federal land (including buildings, structures, utilities, and miscellaneous facilities on the land) in Baudette, Minnesota, to the city of Baudette, to be used for affordable housing or for a purpose related to affordable housing or for infrastructure that provides a public benefit approved by the city.

The property must be sold at fair market value.

Baudette Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

(Sec. 2) This bill directs the Coast Guard to convey specified federal land (including buildings, structures, utilities, and miscellaneous facilities) in Baudette, Minnesota, to the city of Baudette, upon payment to the United States of the property's fair market value.

The fair market value of the covered property must be:

  • determined by a real estate appraiser selected by the city, and licensed to practice in Minnesota; and
  • subject to the approval of the Coast Guard, considering specified requirements regarding use of the property.

Any proceeds received by the United States from a conveyance under this Act shall be deposited in the Coast Guard Housing Fund.

As a condition of any conveyance under this Act, the Coast Guard shall require that all interest in and to the covered property revert to the United States if any part of the property ceases being used for:

  • affordable housing or a related purpose, or
  • infrastructure providing a public benefit approved by the city.

The authority to convey the covered property shall expire four years after this Act's enactment.

bill.title: Baudette Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

item.title: Baudette Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act
To direct the Commandant of the Coast Guard to convey certain property from the United States to the City of Baudette, Minnesota.
Baudette Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
